TopicTitle: Ok. Seriously need help finding a part, here.

Articles.Content:
I\'m trying to make a Titan II-GLV with as much accuracy as possible and I there\'s basically only one or two packs here that have even a couple 1.75M parts. Does anybody know where I can find a decoupler that looks like this in 1.75?

> ![index.php?action=dlattach;topic=11506.0;attach=18491;image](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=11506.0;attach=18491;image)

Any help would be seriously appreciated. Also, does anybody know where I can find any reference photos that show what the second stage of the Titan-II GLV looked like? I can\'t find that anywhere, either. I feel like Gemini was a premeditated conspiracy to make me frustrated at a game that wouldn\'t come out for 50 years. haha

I have just used the SIDR parts to make one.

As for the referance pictures

> ![LR91-AJ-11_rocket_engine.jpg](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/f/f1/LR91-AJ-11_rocket_engine.jpg)
> The second stage engine
> 
> ![news-092410d.jpg](http://www.collectspace.com/images/news-092410d.jpg)
> 
> The main stage without a engine on in.
> 
> ![fig91.jpg](http://history.nasa.gov/SP-4002/images/fig91.jpg)
> 
> The second stage and the first side by side (almost) in vab.
> 
> ![gemini5.jpg](http://www.ericksmodels.com/gallery/gemini/gemini5.jpg)
> 
> The closest thing I found.
> 
>

I should probably scale down one of those interstages to make a 2nd plain 1.75m part like that; the SIDR sleeve is cool looking, but sometimes a plain one is better.

Its on the list of Things To Do.
Thought that the Titan GLV was an SSTO. I\'ve been launching it with 2 1.75m medium NP tanks and a Dual Bertha, it\'s gotten me into Munar orbit. Next step? Land it, because fuck historical accuracy.

> 
> Thought that the Titan GLV was an SSTO.

No. It\'s got two stages before the Gemini spacecraft.

OK. I don\'t want to make a new thread asking for this, so I\'ll ask the people here.

There are basically NO 1.75 meter parts here and it\'s kind of annoying when I\'m trying to build things.

Did you make more 1.75m parts on your own? If not, then where are you getting the other 1.75m parts?

As far as I know, SIDR is the only parts ever made in 1.75m (and due to some rounding issues they aren\'t precisely 1.75, but that\'s a story for another day)

Those parts live on in NovaPunch, and there are 2 different decoupler sleeves that go with the 1.75m tanks and engines, as well as interstage adapters to go from 1.75 down to 1.25 and 1m and up to 2 and 3m. I can\'t imagine what else you need for your Titan.

Also, when you get petulant and demand things of people, it pretty much guarantees they won\'t go to any extra effort to help you. Something to think about.
I remember one or two tanks in 1.75 that weren\'t NP or SIDR. But nobody has any plain white 1.75 decouplers. I had to use a bulkhead and panels to fake a sleeve decoupler.
Take the one in Novapunch, paint the texture white in MS Paint.
KW Challenger\'s payload fairing pack has some 1.75m parts.

Thanks to Tiberion, I have almost completely matched the color scheme of the Titan II GLV!

I never knew how to edit texture colors before, but I\'ve been totally exploiting it for this project.

Here\'s a picture of my Titan II.

> ![index.php?action=dlattach;topic=11506.0;attach=21112;image](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=11506.0;attach=21112;image)

Here\'s a picture of the real deal.

> ![s6421561.jpg](http://www.apollomissionphotos.com/s6421561.jpg)
